newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Uralita to expand in Latin America.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Uralita to expand in Latin America.

text.p: Spanish building material firm Uralita is preparing to expand in Latin America and discard its less profitable businesses, chairman Juan Antonio Garcia said on Monday.
"We are going to follow a more profitable path, without abandoning our financial solidity, towards a more and more international company," Garcia told journalists.
The group intends to invest some 66 billion pesetas until the year 2000 in new and better lines of production, before taking advantage of the Latin American market.

Despite a plunge in 1996 profits, the company sees some improvement in store for the current financial year. It predicts that attributable profit will be in the region of 4.0 billion pesetas, fuelled partly by a recovery in the construction and chemical sectors.
Uralita's 1996 attributable profit plummeted to 2.21 billion pesetas in 1996 from 6.02 billion in 1995 due to weakness in the construction sector and a fall in PVC prices.
Before taking on new expansion projects, the group said it wanted to strengthen its regional presence in Spain and consolidate its activities, managing director Eugenio Ruiz-Galvez said.
The company highlighted it had strong positions in its insulating, covering, piping and plaster businesses.
"We are going to concentrate on those activities that we know well, and abandon margin businesses," Garcia said.
For 1996, the company said it would recommend a final dividend of 15 pesetas to give a total dividend of 25 pesetas compared with 44 pesetas in 1995.
At close of business on Monday, Uralita shares had slipped 15 pesetas to 1,175 in a generally depressed market. (( -- Madrid newsroom + 34 1 585 2161))
